contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the "sword" refers to their enemies. This is a euphemism that means that they were murdered by their enemies. Alternate translation: "My young women and my young men have been murdered by their enemies" or "My enemies have murdered my young women and my young men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: My young women and my young men have fallen by the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to them being dead. Alternate translation: "they have died" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
